name: APMR
body:
## Introduction
Arduino Power Meter Reader (APMR) is an open source hardware and software project. APMR reads the power (W) and energy (Wh) readings of RS485/Modbus communicating power meters at a constant interval. Readings are recorded on an SD cards and/or sent over the Internet using a HTTP RESTful web service.

We are currently working on Version 2.0 which will include some great features (listed in the Release History section). 

Stay tuned.

## The Hardware
APMR used an [Arduino Mega 2560](http://arduino.cc/en/Main/ArduinoBoardMega2560) with two custom shields: the RTC (real-time clock) Shield and the RS485 Shield. 

![Arduino Power Meter Reader](https://raw.github.com/smakonin/APMR/master/resources/apmr_hardware.png "Arduino Power Meter Reader")

Each custom shield can be create using a [Arduino Proto Shield](http://arduino.cc/en/Main/ArduinoProtoShield) and the following schematics: 
 * [The RTC Shield schematic](https://raw.github.com/smakonin/APMR/master/resources/rtc-module-schematic.pdf) _Based on the [SparkFun Real Time Clock Module](http://www.sparkfun.com/products/99)._ ![The RTC Shield](https://raw.github.com/smakonin/APMR/master/resources/rtc_shield.png "The RTC Shield")
 * [The RS485 Shield schematic](https://raw.github.com/smakonin/APMR/master/resources/rs485_shield_schematic.pdf) ![The RS485 Shield](https://raw.github.com/smakonin/APMR/master/resources/rs485_shield.png "The RS485 Shield")

**Version 2.0 (TBA: Not Yet Released)**

* Added feature to save setting/config to EEPROM using browser
* Modified JSON format and accompany web service
* Perform load testing on hardware

**Version 1.1 (July 5, 2012)**

* Added support for DHCP
